group_1.narration: A being that can grant any wish in exchange for your soul...
The folk tales and works of fiction that touch upon this theme,@such as Goethe's "Faust," are too numerous@to ever fully count.
And I had one thing that I could see myself wishing for,@if I were to ever find myself in such a situation.
Even if I were to offer up my soul in exchange...

group_1.textRight: (Well, it was only ever a thought experiment...@something I fantasized about, in short.)
(Of course, I certainly never fantasized...)
(...That I would encounter something like this@in real life.)
(However...)
(The power Kyubey used to transform them is@real.)
(Faced with an opportunity like this...)
(There's no way I can turn this offer down.)

group_1.textLeft: Have you decided on your wish, Temari Kira?

group_1.textRight: ...Yes.
"I want the words I weave to reach somebody's@heart."
That's my wish!

group_1.textLeft: You have quite a taste for the literary arts,@yes?
So do you mean that you want your works to@attract readers?

group_1.textRight: Correct.
...That said, I don't particularly care about@writing best-sellers.
Specifically, I want the poems, novels,@critiques and so on...
...That I put out into the world as an author...
...To reach the people who need those works@from the bottom of their hearts.
...Even if that happens to be long after my@death.

group_1.textLeft: The contract is complete.
From now on, the works and essays woven@together by your words...
...Should be guaranteed to reach the heart@of anyone who needs them.

group_1.textRight: Your wish was SO cool.
Like, you didn't wish to become a critical@darling, or for literary talent...
Not for any of the usual stuff!

group_1.textLeft: Can't the same be said for all three of us?

group_1.textRight: Are there any authors you particularly admire?@Anyone who's like a role model for you?

group_1.textLeft: In my case, I just naturally enjoyed poetry@and books...
...And came to the conclusion that I couldn't@truly understand their authors' feelings...
...Until I tried to write something of my own.
That was really my only motivation to start@writing...
...So I wouldn't say I have any particular favorites.
That said, as I spent so much time engaging with@works both new and old...
I discovered that there were many authors who@were buried in obscurity.
Never being blessed by luck, nor the fashion of@their time.

group_1.textRight: Geniuses buried in history...?

group_1.textLeft: Exactly. Ill-fated authors who had talent@comparable to all-time greats...
Yet who went unremarked-upon by later eras'@critics, were never reevaluated after their deaths,
And just disappeared quietly.
Novels never read...@Poetry never recited...
Plays never performed...@Essays never reflected upon...
It's essentially as if they don't exist.@I felt terrible for all those words written down.
That's why I made my wish.

group_1.textRight: So, "you wanted the words you wove to reach@somebody's heart"...?

group_1.textLeft: Exactly. As such...
I believe that my magic must have something to@do with "words".

group_1.textRight: Or perhaps "literature".

group_1.textLeft: Also likely.
Film aficionado Mihono can use her magic for things@like changing the brightness of her surroundings...
...To create bright nights ideal for filming.
"La nuit américaine,"@I believe it's called.
I'd like to think that I have a similarly useful@type of magic...

group_1.textRight: Ah, senpais...!@There you are.
I've been looking for you, you know?

group_1.textLeft: Ah... sorry!@Is it that late already?!

group_1.textRight: Yep! It's time to make our rounds!

group_1.textLeft: I suppose we spent too much time chatting.@Let's go, Komachi.

group_1.textRight: Up until a little while ago, I couldn't have@imagined us searching for Witches on a daily basis.

group_1.textLeft: ...Right you are.

group_1.textRight: This...!

group_1.textLeft: ...Seems to be a Witch.

group_1.textRight: Let's go, senpai!
